chapter.title: Java JDK Setup
chapter.para: You will need a copy of the Java 6 SDK installed. The Java 7 JDK is available but I have not yet tried it.

note.para: Keep the 32/64-bit choice consistent with what you download later for Eclipse.

listitem.para: Linux Users: The alternate JDKs (e.g., OpenJDK) available from your package manager will work fine for class.
Windows Users: Install the Java 6 JDK from Sun/Oracle

Download a copy of the Java 6 JDK http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html . Choose Java SE 6 Update (latest) JDK. We will only be using the JDK portion in class so avoid the alternate downloads that add in the Glassfish JavaEE Application Server and NetBeans. We will be using JBoss and Eclipse.
Install the JDK and associated JRE in a directory that does not have spaces in its path.

section.title: Verify your JDK is installed
